intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis globifera, commonly known as the globe-shaped orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its small, compact growth habit. The plant produces intricate flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with a distinctive, rounded shape. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts.
